abstract: The two-month-old writers strike took a significant toll on the “People’s Choice Awards” on Tuesday, as the taped, scaled-down version on CBS lost nearly half its audience compared with a year ago. The show attracted 6 million viewers from 9 to 11 p.m., according to Nielsen’s estimates, down from the 11.3 million people who watched the show’s live broadcast on the same night last year.
lead_paragraph: The two-month-old writers strike took a significant toll on the “People’s Choice Awards” on Tuesday, as the taped, scaled-down version on CBS lost nearly half its audience compared with a year ago. The show attracted 6 million viewers from 9 to 11 p.m., according to Nielsen’s estimates, down from the 11.3 million people who watched the show’s live broadcast on the same night last year.

headline.main: The People’s Choice: Tune Out the Awards
